thread.title: Mariah Carey Hits the Gym in Heels and Fishnets -- and Even Rihanna Is Impressed
thread.title_full: Mariah Carey Hits the Gym in Heels and Fishnets -- and Even Rihanna Is Impressed

author: Jackie Willis
title: Mariah Carey Hits the Gym in Heels and Fishnets -- and Even Rihanna Is Impressed
text: Mariah Carey Hits the Gym in Heels and Fishnets -- and Even Rihanna Is Impressed by Jackie Willis 6:23 AM PST, February 03, 2017 Photo: Instagram Mariah Carey just skipped the athleisure trend altogether and went straight for glam-leisure. The 46-year-old singer hit the weights and the stair climber at celebrity trainer Gunnar Peterson's gym on Thursday night, but did not change into sweats while working on her fitness. Instead, Carey wore fishnets, a cleavage-baring leotard, a gold statement necklace and FENTxPuma heels, which cost between $375 and $600. WATCH: Mariah Carey Rocks Sexy Lingerie Looks, a Bridal Garter in Cover Art for New Breakup Single ‘I Don’t’ In one video posted to Instagram, Carey is seen playfully "running amok" through the gym, while in another, she's casually lifting weights. "We must we must," she wrote, referring to the rhyme "we must, we must, we must increase our bust." In her final post from the gym, Carey is seen sexily posing on a stair climber. "Climb every mountain," she wrote. A video posted by Mariah Carey (@mariahcarey) on Feb 2, 2017 at 7:18pm PST A video posted by Mariah Carey (@mariahcarey) on Feb 2, 2017 at 7:30pm PST Rihanna regrammed this photo, excited to see that Carey was wearing heels from her Puma collection. "Yo I made it!!! @mariahcarey in #FENTYxPUMA," she quipped. A photo posted by badgalriri (@badgalriri) on Feb 2, 2017 at 8:54pm PST WATCH: WATCH: Mariah Ditches Her Engagement Ring, Says She's 'Really Happy' With Boyfriend Bryan Tanaka Carey recently released a new breakup song , "I Don't," after calling off her engagement from James Packer. "I know you love me. You just don't trust me," she sings. "You need to understand me." Check out her "I Don't ," and what the GRAMMY winner had to say about releasing even more new music: RELATED SLIDESHOW
